title: The Diary of a Goose Girl
description: Another heartwarming tale from the author of Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. The story begins: "In alluding to myself as a Goose Girl, I am using only the most modest of my titles; for I am also a poultry maid, a tend of Belgian hares and rabbits, and a shepherdess; but I particularly fancy the role of Goose Girl, because it recalls the German fairy tales of my early youth, when I always yearned, but never hoped, to be precisely what I now am."
author: Kate Douglas Wiggin
